page.title: 01Rock and Rennington
page.content: Rock grew up as an estate village centred on Rock Hall built round a medieval pele tower. The hall is now used as a youth hostel with laboratory facilities. Rock church was originally a chapel in Embleton parish. The Rock estates is farmed by the Bosanquets, a Huguenot family who bought the land C1800. The village of Rennington was also once part of Embleton parish. The original Norman Chapel was replaced by a new church in the 19c. Recently many new houses have been built in the village and the vicarage turned into a nursing home. The other centre in this area is Stamford, it now consists only of a farm and a few cottages. However, it was once of considerably greater importance than either Rock or Rennington. In early medieval time it was the centre of the Barony of Emble- ton with roots going back to Saxon
